statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: ATLANTIC SUN TR AT JOHNSON CITY TN

article.headline: Lipscomb 78, Mercer 62
article.story: JOHNSON CITY, Tenn. (AP) -- Getting 18 points each from Eddie Ard and Brian Fisk, top-seeded Lipscomb pounded Mercer 78-62 in the quarterfinals of the Atlantic Sun tournament Thursday at Memorial Center. Lipscomb (20-9) advanced to the semifinals, where it will play the winner of Thursday night's game between East Tennessee State University and Gardner-Webb. The game was stagnant early with eighth-seeded Mercer keeping pace until deep in the opening half. However, the Bisons got a 3-pointer from Brian Fisk to break a 19-19 tie with 4:24 to go. They expanded their lead to 31-26 at the break. Then Lipscomb started the second half with an 18-4 burst to make it 49-30. The Bears (9-19) made one small push to get back in the game, scoring seven straight points to pull within 63-48 with just over eight minutes left. But Mercer could get no closer the rest of the way. Ard, a sophomore forward, also had five steals and led the team with five rebounds. LaKory Daniels chipped in with 10 points. The Bears were led in scoring by Andrew Brown, who had 12 points. Brian Pfohl added 10 points. Montavious Waters totaled eight points and eight rebounds.
